We have to infer from the set of statements. It seems these statements define a directed graph of ancestry: "X is Y's ancestor" means X is ancestor of Y. "X is Y's descendant" means X is descendant of Y, i.e., Y is ancestor of X. So we have both directions: some statements say ancestor, some say descendant.
